group_1.narration: It happened quite a long time ago.
I was even busier than I am now, @overwhelmed with chores for the studio.

group_1.textLeft: Okay, lessons are done for today.

group_1.textCenter: (Yeah, yeah, go ahead and yell at me. I still@have to go deal with the family finances!)
(No matter how many times you tell me not@to run, I'm just gonna do it!)
Trusty old bike, don't fail me now!
Today we're going to that supermarket in@Mizuna Ward!

group_1.textRight: I was waiting for your classes to finish.@I figured maybe we could go hang out?

group_1.textLeft: I'm glad you keep inviting me, but I can't@make it today, either...
I have to go shopping, and the store's@pretty far away...
Well, we have students that live with us@that I need to take care of...
So it's tougher for us to live day-to-day@than your average family.

group_1.textRight: Should you be handling that? You're a kid.

group_1.textLeft: Well, it's not like the guys are going to do@it, so I have to do it...
Besides, if I didn't have this, then there'd@be no place for me.

group_1.textRight: I just can't wrap my head around it.@You could just run away...
You're going to end up collapsing under the@pressure, you know.

group_1.textLeft: I can get through anything with a smile!

group_1.narration: In Kosho Ward studios,@the men stay at the studio while@the women take care of the housework.
My home, the Amane Bamboo Studio,@still follows all those outdated rules.

group_1.textCenter: I wish I could go have some fun...
